Posts.Content: tooyoungtohavebc wrote: Last night was the first time in 7 months that I have slept 8 hours straight without any meds to help!!Gosh I am excited! I normally toss and turn all night and wake up almost always at 3:30 and then again at 5am before I finally get up for work. I tried a few pills some nights to help but they always make me tired the next day and I am pretty much an anti pill person anyway. But last night I went to bed at 11 and woke up about 7:30 and was shocked when I looked at the clock. Maybe I finally turned a corner!! I am one of those people who has to get 8 hours or it gets ugly:) so this sleep struggle has been a big deal for me. Crossing my fingers for more of these! Dx 6/2005, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I finally slept 8 hours straight!!! tooyoungtohavebc heatherpalmerton

Posts.Content: tooyoungtohavebc wrote: So had my first infusion of ixempra yesterday. Turns out that I am only the second gal at the hospital to have this...guinea pig here. Besides the fact that the whole process takes 5 hours...aggghhh...not too bad. But today I woke up and face is all red. Anyone else had this? Assume it is some sort of allergic reaction. Besides this feel fine. Am waiting for the other shoe to drop. Interestingly enough i was recently having nerve problems in the arm where i had node removal and this first does of ixempra helped. think my tumor under arm must have been pressing on some nerves or something. Dx 6/2005, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: tooyoungtohavebc wrote: Found out last week that nodes above collar bone are recurrence as I suspected. Had a PET scan last week to see if node under arm showed cancer which it did. Also expected this. PET also showed a lesion on my liver. WTF...I was not expecting this at all since CT scan showed nothing besides 2 areas we knew about. Has anyone had their PET be wrong? Does biopsy of liver usually follow? Ok getting freaked out now. Dx 6/2005, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: tooyoungtohavebc wrote: AGGHHHHHH!! so after 2 biopsies and a CT scan, was told today that yes it is back! I am SO MADDDDDD!! and i am so over cancer! I only finished treatment last september. Just got my energy back in january. not ready for this at all. i knew it was back, i knew it, i knew it! luckily it has not spread to my other organs, but CT scan showed something under my arm too so now they have to figure out if it came back in axilla too. Just praying that I do not have to do chemo. If it is only in lymph near collar bone then I do rads only. ok done venting now... Posts.Content: tooyoungtohavebc wrote: Ok so finished chemo/Ixempra only one month ago and I have something new forming on the skin under my arm. I had skin mets develop there in the spring. It took my doc a while to figure out what they were and I finally went on ixempra. The mets that were there disappeared and now that I have stopped chemo, something new is there. It does not look like the other skin mets, but it is raised and it is getting bigger. Have an email out to my doc....BUT YOU HAVE GOT TO BE FRIGGIN KIDDING ME!!! HOW IS THIS CRAP GROWING SOOOOO FAST. I will just fall apart if he tells me I need more chemo. I HATE CHEMO HATE CHEMO HATE CHEMO...Ixempra just about killed me (it felt like it anyway) and my body has not even recovered. My feet and hands still feel arthritic. I am still so fatigued at the end of the day and the nausea continues ( and do you think I have lost weight because of it...nooooooooooooooooo) Ok I am done bitching now! Thanks for tolerating my outburst! Dx 6/2005, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: My 2 best features...screwed by cancer! tooyoungtohavebc Micmel

Posts.Content: tooyoungtohavebc wrote: Was having an email exchange with one of my friends about long term ongoing chemo. Thought I would share my stance as I know you gals will understand. I admire the women here who continue to endure chemo after chemo and who are on chemo with no end in sight. You are champs! I have done 4 types so far and all have worked for me in shrinking the tumors, but I do think I will reach a saturation point because after each chemo cancer started growing again. Keep in mind I don't have kids, and I did watch my mother die a slow death from cancer when I was very young. Am I alone in feeling like this? When is enough, enough? Anyway here is the email to my friend.... "Want to clarify about what I started to tell you. It's not that I don't have anything to live for and thus want to stop long term chemo if that is what I will face, it is more a matter of, is this really living, is this how I want to live for whatever years I have left. And I don't.   Not being able to leave the house cuz I am too tired for days at a time...is not living. Not being able to vacation because of how I feel...not living. Even having visitors come is difficult because it's exhausting. So to me there is being alive and then there is living. I dont want to stay alive just because. I know people luv me and I luv many, including you. I wish that were enough to make me want to suffer through life long chemo, but it isn't. I know I will see my friends and loved ones again somewhere. So that part doesn't scare me. I do not want to just breathe to exist. I want to experience life and to me that means more than just being housebound and sick.   Anyway I am not at the point where I have to make this decision yet, but I have thought about it. I have my last chemo tomorrow and will get a break after that. But if this crap keeps progressing, I am just not sure I will continue to douse my body with toxins to give myself a few more months of breathing. These are the choices some of us have to make in our life and let me tell you, watching my mother die slowly of cancer def has played a part in what I am willing to do." Dx 6/2005, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: chemo forever...not for me tooyoungtohavebc PineHouse

Posts.Content: tooyoungtohavebc wrote: Hiya Had CT scan few weeks ago and Onc was pleased that tumor under arm and in liver appear to be getting smaller. Got back blood test from last week and tumor markers, CA 15-3, went up. They have almost tripled in the past few months. I know the tumor markers aren't exact, but anyone else had this occur? WASSUP? Think it might be somewhere that CT does not show...? Dx 6/2005, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anyone have markers go up but tumors go down? tooyoungtohavebc Member_of_the_Club

Posts.Content: tooyoungtohavebc wrote: Had to take one of my older cats to the vet to get some teeth removed. Hubby picked him up after the procedure and came home with some meds to give the cat while he was healing. I looked at the medication and just laughed and said "You gotta be kidding me!" The vet prescribed Clindamycin! For those of you that don't know, this is a drug prescribed to help with infections. I personally was on Clindamycin a few months ago while taking Tykerb. Saw my onc today and said..."so you had me on cat meds huh."  Told him the story and he just cracked up. Too funny that me and my cat did the same drug!! Dx 6/2005, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Funny Story! tooyoungtohavebc Lynn1

Posts.Content: tooyoungtohavebc wrote: I am out of my mind today. Have been participating in the clinical trial for TDM-1..super herceptin..last scan looked stable, but when I saw doc last month I told him I thought it was growing in an area under my arm towards my back and he couldnt really tell and scans looked good so I had another infusion. Well back to doc this morn and I told him I didn't notice much improvement and still felt other stuff was growing. So he examined me and agrees that while some of the areas feel and look different, that it appears that the stuff that I suspected was growing...IS growing!!! F**K!! Why do I always have to be right about this stuff.. When I asked him what was next he was unsure. He wants to do MRI first because my left arm/hand has had numbness again so he wants to check that out first. THIS IS SO DEPRESSING!! I need a shot of booze stat Dx 6/2005, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Well I am out of the clinical trial..progression tooyoungtohavebc tooyoungtohavebc

Posts.Content: tooyoungtohavebc wrote: Last 3 weeks my tummy has been so swollen. Have some pain in my right side (yep I already have liver mets) and lot of nausea, headaches. Just don't feel right. Saw onc today and said he wants to do another scan. Just had two months ago which showed no progression. Now am thinking something is going on. I feel like my insides are swollen. Am on tykerb/xeloda combo. Anyone else had these symptoms and have it turn out to be nothing? Can't tell if it is just side effects from drugs or something else. But I know I did not feel like this a month ago. Getting worried Dx 6/2005, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: swollen belly, side pain etc tooyoungtohavebc tooyoungtohavebc

Posts.Content: tooyoungtohavebc wrote: This is kind of funny actually. Had a bone scan as part of my screening to get into the TDM1 clinical trial. Doc was reviewing the scan and I asked him what he saw. He said there is one area of interest near my lower spine. But then he says, " You also have more arthritis than most people your age." I started laughing and said, "oh great something else I inherited from my parents." I have been having pain in my right shoulder. I was thinking it might be cancer, but now I think it is arthritis. Ok I am only 42...or so my birth certificate says.... oh well...never knew I had arthritis! Dx 6/2005, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Now I have Arthritis!! Whaaaa?? tooyoungtohavebc lovinmomma

Posts.Content: tooyoungtohavebc wrote: And I really am not a whimpy gal. I have always been told I was tough, but I just got so frustrated. Doc said I could have my decadron lowered for chemo cuz I am not sleeping and I know it is because of the steroids, and nurse and pharmacy would not do it. So she brings in this woman who tells me the steroids are not the cause of my disrupted sleep and that with the dosage I have the steroid should be out of my system within 24 hours. I think that is a load of crap because I have had this steroid before and know how I respond. So I started crying and told her to leave and that she was not being helpful. I also told her that I researched Ixempra online and there were some women who were not getting decadron or steroids with the infusion. So she left. Well she came back a few hours later and told me she did some research and that I was right. Ixempra could be given without steroids, so for my next infusion I could skip it! Doesn't help me this time does it...I have never melted down at chemo before but I have not slept a solid 5 hours for at least 7 weeks and it is wearing on me and sleeping pills are not helping. AGGGHHHH. Ok am doubling my sleeping pill dosage tonight and praying for some good sleep. thanks for listening...gosh i have turned into a whiner no...not a wino Dx 6/2005, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
